summary: A letter from defense attorney Jeffrey S. Pagliuca to an Assistant United States Attorney concerning the use of sealed discovery materials in the civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell. The letter objects to the government's confidential designation of certain 'Unsealing Materials' and requests permission to reference them in ongoing litigation before Judge Preska and the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Author of the letter, representing Ghislaine Maxwell. He is actively litigating issues related to the disclosure of confidential material and objects to the government's designation of certain discovery materials as confidential.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of Jeffrey S. Pagliuca. She is named as a defendant in settled civil matters and is involved in litigation concerning the unsealing of discovery materials.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who entered the Protective Order in the case. The defense intends to ask her for permission to refer to and attach certain discovery materials as exhibits.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: The judge overseeing the unsealing protocol in the civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell. The disputed materials would be disclosed to her as part of an appeal appendix.

connections.description: Pagliuca is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in litigation concerning the disclosure of confidential discovery materials.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell and entered the Protective Order that is central to the dispute in this letter.
Judge Preska is overseeing the unsealing protocol in the related civil case, Giuffre v. Maxwell, where Maxwell is a defendant.

events.title: Government Designates Materials Confidential
events.description: The government sent a letter to defense counsel designating the 'Unsealing Materials' as Confidential.

events.title: Defense Objects to Confidential Designation
events.description: Defense attorney Jeffrey S. Pagliuca sends a letter objecting to the government's confidential designation of the 'Unsealing Materials' and requests the designation be withdrawn.

events.title: Deadline for Meeting on Unsealing Protocol
events.description: Judge Preska ordered that parties in the civil case meet regarding modifications to the unsealing protocol by this date.

keyFacts: The defense for Ghislaine Maxwell is actively litigating the disclosure of confidential material in the civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell and a related appeal in the Second Circuit.
The defense objects to the government's 'Confidential' designation of certain 'Unsealing Materials', arguing they are judicial documents with a presumptive right of public access.
The 'Unsealing Materials' consist of ex parte pleadings filed by the Government, transcripts of ex parte hearings, and ex parte rulings from settled civil cases where Maxwell was a defendant.
The law firm Boies, Schiller & Flexner is identified as an entity outside the prosecution that is aware of the Unsealing Materials and was cooperating with the Government.
The Second Circuit Court of Appeals had established an expedited briefing schedule, creating urgency for the defense to resolve the confidentiality issue with Judge Nathan.
